item.description: Mathematical foundations of semantic programming/modelling Goncharov S.S., Ershov Yu.L., Sviridenko D.I. Methodology aspects of the semantic programming // Scientific knowledge: logic, notions, structure. ‚Äì Novosibirsk, Nauka 1987, pp. 154-184. S.S. Goncharov, D.I. Sviridenko Mathematical Foundations of Semantic Programming Paper.Academy of Science of USSR.–1986.– T.289,No 6 S.S. Goncharov, D.I. Sviridenko Œ£-Programming Amer. Math. Soc. Transl. (2) Vol. 142, 1989. Available online: https://goo.gl/QcocUc D.I. Sviridenko Introduction into Semantic Smart Contracts https://goo.

Mathematical definition of \(\Delta_0\)-formulas Definition If \(P \) is a predicate symbol, \(P \in \sigma \), and \( ùë°_1,…,t_n \) are symbols of constants of the signature \(\sigma\), or variables, then \( P(ùë°_1,…,t_n)\) is a \(\Delta_0 \)-formula. If \( \phi \) and \( \psi \) are \( \Delta_0 \)-formulas, then \( \phi \wedge \psi, \phi \vee \psi , \phi \rightarrow \psi, \neg \psi \) are \( \Delta_0 \)-formulas. If \( \phi \) is a \( \Delta_0 \)-formula, ùë• is a variable, and ùëô is a finite list, then \( (\forall x \in l)\phi (x) \) and \( (\exists x \in l)\phi (x) \) are \( \Delta_0 \)-formulas.
